This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!

Since this post doesnâ€™t specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.

title: About
text: Karl Ho: Political scientist working at the intersection of data science and social science. My research interests span both domains of data analytics and political studies, with a regional focus on East Asia. The unifying theme of my research is to use data science methods to explain and prescribe social and political problems. Areas of research topics include democratization, political economy, public policy and human rights aiming at building public goods and improving policies, governance and representation.

x=rnorm(100)
y=rnorm(100)
plot(x,y)



plot(x,y, pch=20, col = "firebrick") # Scatterplot for two numeric variables by default



plot(x,y, pch=20, col = "steelblue",xlab="this is the x-axis",ylab="this is the y-axis",main="Plot of X vs Y") # Add labels



pdf("Figure01.pdf") # Save as pdf, add a path or it will be stored on the project directory
plot(x,y,pch=20, col="forestgreen") # Try different colors?
dev.off() # Close the file using the dev.off function

quartz_off_screen
